title: Medical Curriculum Design Applying Cognitive Load Reduction Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and understanding of human anatomical structures
context.additional_context: Environment where learners primarily use smartphones and engage in small-group collaboration via real-time video conferencing, aiming for systematic acquisition and long-term retention of medical knowledge

learning_goals: Learners can restructure the learning path for nine core medical subjects within four weeks according to cognitive load reduction strategies.
Learners can improve learning outcomes by more than 15% at each subject stage.
Learners can identify cognitive load indicators (e.g., chunking, sequential presentation) for each learning path with 80% accuracy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
